metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7810 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Expression Language (EL) implementation in Apache Tomcat 6.x before6.0.44, 7.x before 7.0.58, and 8.x before 8.0.16 does not properly considerthe possibility of an accessible interface implemented by an inaccessibleclass, which allows attackers to bypass a SecurityManager protectionmechanism via a web application that leverages use of incorrect privilegesduring EL evaluation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.61-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.61-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.61-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.61-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.61-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.61-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.61-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.22-2
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.22-2
tomcat8 - 8.0.22-2
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.22-2
tomcat8-common - 8.0.22-2
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.22-2
tomcat8-user - 8.0.22-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1').
tomcat7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.61-1').
tomcat8 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.22-2').
